text: cool, are you copying the lighting? a time-lapsey day to dusk and a few new little camera moves might cool. What do you have to end up with for the assignment, is it just stills?

Yeah just a still its my final year project so entirely up to me. Im intending to get a cinematic of the shot and my lecturer suggested the idea of a timelapse of day to night as well. Might try that with an ai sky or animate a hdri?

friend from my course filmed a time lapse of his room, and some random cg student from korea copied it for their project, but the light raking stuff works really well

<https://vimeo.com/266479327> - original
<https://vimeo.com/310062408> - cg remake

attachments.title: Talk from Home | Timelapse 4K
attachments.text:
A timelapse film shot around my flat in London. The film was shot over 3 months from late winter to early spring, where the sun inclination was low and the light stretched across the rooms in the flat.

Music is Talk from Home by Suzanne Kraft. If you like the music, you can buy and check out the whole album on the link below:



It's an incredible album and I highly recommend you check out.

text: Ill give them a look then as they sound very useful! Im just in that annoying stage of modelling the smaller assets to fill the rest of the scene then i can fully focus on texturing and lighting the shots
